TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit PublisherIdentityPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission

Docs.summary: Represents the identity of a software publisher. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], identity permissions are not used. > > In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, identity permissions cannot have an <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted> permission state value. Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, identity permissions can have any permission state value. This means that in 2.0 and later versions, identity permissions have the same behavior as permissions that implement the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission> interface. That is, a demand for an identity always succeeds, regardless of the identity of the assembly, if the assembly has been granted full trust. > > In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, demands on the identity permissions are effective, even when the calling assembly is fully trusted. That is, although the calling assembly has full trust, a demand for an identity permission fails if the assembly does not meet the demanded criteria. Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, demands for identity permissions are ineffective if the calling assembly has full trust. This assures consistency for all permissions, eliminating the treatment of identity permissions as a special case.
> [!NOTE] > By default, code access security does not check for <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher> evidence. Unless your computer has a custom code group based on the <xref:System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition> class, you can improve performance by bypassing Authenticode signature verification. This is accomplished by configuring the runtime to not provide <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher> evidence for code access security. For more information about how to configure this option and which applications can use it, see the element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate certificate) cil managed

Docs.param: An X.509 certificate representing the software publisher's identity.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified Authenticode X.509v3 certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The X.509 certificate defines the identity of the specified software publisher, as established by Authenticode code signing.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not a valid certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Creates either a fully restricted (`None`) or `Unrestricted` permission.
> [!NOTE] > In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, identity permissions cannot have an <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted> permission state value. Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, identity permissions can have any permission state value. This means that in 2.0 and later versions, identity permissions have the same behavior as permissions that implement the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission> interface. That is, a demand for an identity always succeeds, regardless of the identity of the assembly, if the assembly has been granted full trust.
In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, demands on the identity permissions are effective, even when the calling assembly is fully trusted. That is, although the calling assembly has full trust, a demand for an identity permission fails if the assembly does not meet the demanded criteria. Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, demands for identity permissions are ineffective if the calling assembly has full trust. This assures consistency for all permissions, eliminating the treatment of identity permissions as a special case.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.%23ctor%28System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission/CPP/publisheridentitypermission.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission/CS/publisheridentitypermission.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission/VB/publisheridentitypermission.vb#7)]

Docs.exception: The parameter is not a valid value of .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an Authenticode X.509v3 certificate that represents the identity of the software publisher.
Docs.value: An X.509 certificate representing the identity of the software publisher.
Docs.exception: The is not a valid certificate.
The property cannot be set because the identity is ambiguous.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement esd) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the permission.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs a permission with a specified state from an XML encoding.
Docs.exception:
The parameter is not a valid permission element.
-or-
The parameter's version number is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.
<xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission> only supports set operations (<xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Intersect%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Union%2A>) when the current permission is equal to the specified permission.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the two permissions are equal. If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents the same access to the protected resource as the specified permission.
<xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission> supports set operations (<xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Intersect%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Union%2A>) only when the current permission is equal to the specified permission.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission and its current state.
Docs.returns: An XML encoding of the permission, including any state information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The result of a call to the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Union%2A> method is a permission that represents all the operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.
The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission> class only supports set operations (<xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Intersect%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission.Union%2A>) when the current permission is equal to the specified permission.

Docs.exception:
The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.
-or-
The two permissions are not equal.
